p:
In 1989, this classification was first published grading diffuse axonal injury [ 58]:
Grade 1: histological evidence of axonal injury in the white matter of the cerebral hemispheres, the corpus callosum, the brain stem, and, less usually, the cerebellum.
Grade 2: there is also a focal lesion in the corpus callosum.
Grade 3: there is, in addition, a focal lesion in the dorsolateral quadrant or quadrants of the rostral brain stem.
